--------------------
This came from the "NOVA" TV series.

Presented by Neil deGrasse Tyson (No relation to Mike Tyson) this program takes us on a 
light hearted journey which explores how our understanding of the cosmos has been transformed
again and again.

With the big bang the cosmos, all the matter, all the energy that would ever exist, burst into being in a single instant. A flash of light filled the cosmos. As it expanded, that light stretched with it to longer and longer wavelengths, through the visible range to the infrared.

Today that first flash remains as a faint glow of microwaves filling the sky. But how did our cosmos come to be filled with clumps of stuff, galaxies, suns, and planets? 

And my question, how many times has this happened ?
